author: ajsutton
content:
I think what Vitalik was trying to get at was that currently we give say 10ETH in total as potential rewards for sync committee participation and they go to the 100 lucky participants, so they have an incentive of 0.1ETH each.
But if we share that 10ETH budget across all validators, then the reward for each validator winds up being much much less - with 100,000 validators it would be 0.00001ETH.

So if you only penalize what they were automatically granted, it doesn't cost them very much to just ignore sync committee duties.  So to get the same level of incentive you'd have to penalise them much more than each validator is paid.

author: ajsutton
content: I can see that something needed to be changed, but I really struggle to get my head around how the two different proposals will play out in terms of how people actually change their decisions because of it.  The math is one thing but I suspect people won't understand the fine details anyway. So depending on what they do understand and what stands out, they could be quite irrational in quite unpredictable ways which makes it very hard to reason about.

author: ajsutton
content: And for the record, I wasn't trying to belittle the importance of the differences in the proposal when I was asking about how much it mattered to pick the right answer now. It's just always good to consider what options open up because we can make changes in the future.

author: djrtwo
content: probably partially historic. They started entirely as markdown and generally in plaintext. Then they started having more and more code snippets for complex components. Then they almost entirely went to being defined in python code and the build code was added

author: samwilsn
content: Alright, thanks!

author: djrtwo
content: It does make for an arguably better reading experience for a less code-centric/python person but at the end of the day most of the meat is in the code

author: djrtwo
content: on the flip, p2p spec is far more standard spec def with few python code snippets

author: djrtwo
